## Spaghetti and Meatballs

<span class="mh">Servings:</span>2 servings
<br>

<span class="mh">Ingredients:</span>  
<div class="my2cols">
<ul>
  <li>1 TBSP olive oil</li>
  <li>Half an onion, diced </li>
  <li>2-3 clove garlic, minced finely</li>
  <li>700 grams of diced tomatoes (I usually use 400g canned tomotoes, 300g fresh)</li>
  <li>salt, pepper, basil, oregeno to taste</li>
  <li>228 g of Bionature Gluten Free Spaghetti</li>
  <li>6 Vegan Meatballs; either fresh or reheat for 5-10 min at 325 degrees</li> 
  <li>A massive amount of freshly grated Violife Parmesan</li> 
</ul>
</div>
<br>
<span class="mh">Directions:</span> 
<div class="my2cols">
<ol>
  <li>Heat water in big pot on high</li>
  <li>Prep food (cut onions, garlic, tomatoes, parmesan)</li>
  <li>Heat oil in pan on median</li>
  <li>Add onion, garlic<br><i>Optional: add sliced mushrooms</i></li>
  <li>Saute for 2-4 minutes until onion is translucent</li> 
  <li>Spice it up: salt, pepper, dried oregano, dried basil</li> 
  <li>Stir for a few more minutes, then add tomoatoes, bring to a boil then cover and simmer for at least20-30 min</li> 
  <li>Add pasta to boiling water, cook for 8-9 minutes</li>
  <li>Add spinach to pan and stir in; if adding fresh herbs stir in now </li> 
  <li>After done cooking pasta, strain pasta and mix into pan </li> 
  <li>Divide evenly into 2 bowls, add meatballs </li> 
  <li>Top with Parmesan</li> 
</ol>
</div>


<span class="mh">Time:</span> 1hr if meatballs already cooked; 2 hrs if making meatballs
